episodes.title: 67. Right-Wing Politics Are Infiltrating Education (with R/B Mertz)
episodes.description:
Join us for Part 2 of our conversation with author, poet, queer parent, fellow FUS alum, and sometime college professor R/B Mertz. In this episode, we're discussing the education system, higher ed, right-wing politics, and how it all impacts the queer community and beyond.

check out R/B's other work, including their debut memoir, Burning Butch: ⁠https://rbmertz.com/⁠

episodes.title: 65. Happy New Year! December Deconstruction, Advent Edition
episodes.description: Join Veronica for a chat about deconstructing in December with all the complicated feelings that Advent and Christmas bring when you've been deconstructing. Here's some links to resources on the holiday season. While these articles are all targeted to the LGBTQ+ community, I hope they might be helpful even if you are straight and cisgender! - 8 Queer Tips to Get Through the Holidays - Queer Theology - Going Home for the Holidays - The Trevor Project - 5 Holiday Tips for LGBTQ+ People in Recovery - The Center - Making It Through the Holidays as an LGBTQ+ Person - SFGMC ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠order a candle here! leave laugh love on Apple Podcasts: https://bit.ly/4owQNOi leave laugh love on Spotify: https://bit.ly/3WWIXlf leave laugh love on Instagram: / leavelaughlovepod support us on Patreon! / leavelaughlovepod #leavelaughlove #catholicism #fundamentalism #deconstruction

episodes.title: straight as the default hurts the church too
episodes.description:
Today we unpack compulsory heterosexuality (“comphet”)—how church culture, gender scripts, and fear of exclusion pushed us to date men, plan marriages, and mistake deep friendship for attraction. We share the slow, messy process of naming queerness, the survival calculus of staying in community, and why silence around sexuality harms everyone—including the Church. From youth group purity talk to adult deconstruction, this is a candid look at desire, honesty, and building a life that actually fits.

episodes.title: Theos Bros vs Church Girlies w/ Cade Bradley (@GayExTrad)
episodes.description:
Evelyn, Veronica, and Cade compare the wildly different messages men and women receive in Catholic spaces—porn-and-purity men’s talks vs. dignity-and-modesty women’s talks—then track how those scripts shape deconstruction, dating, and identity. From Theo-bro debate culture to confession-as-streaks, “feminine genius” to closeting strategies, we unpack power, fear, and why over-intellectualizing feelings keeps people stuck—and how to get free.

episodes.title: 62. Leaving High-Control Religion: Making New Meaning (ft. Cherie @canceledchristian)
episodes.description: We sit down with Cherie - aka “The Canceled Christian” - to unpack life inside high-control evangelical spaces: homeschooling, purity culture, and rules at Pensacola Christian College, plus the cracks that formed during 2020 and after Dobbs. Cherie shares how she and her husband deconstructed together, why empathy (not outrage) moved her most, and practical advice for taking it slow, finding a “deconstruction buddy,” and keeping whatever spirituality still fits. find more of cherie on tiktok: leave laugh love on Apple Podcasts: https://bit.ly/4owQNOi leave laugh love on Spotify: https://bit.ly/3WWIXlf leave laugh love on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/leavelaughlovepod/ support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/LeaveLaughLovePod #leavelaughlove #catholicism #fundamentalism #deconstruction 00:00 Small Group: Rose and Thorn 02:17 Cherie's Background and Deconstruction Journey 04:23 Navigating Marriage and Deconstruction 06:12 College Experiences and Questioning Beliefs 15:25 Working at Starbucks and Meeting Non-Christians 25:18 Starting on Social Media and Shiny Happy People 28:23 Understanding Cult Dynamics 33:43 Navigating Political and Religious Tensions 36:45 Personal Deconstruction Journeys 43:49 Advice for Those Deconstructing

episodes.title: 61. What We Loved Most From Our Catholic Upbringing (Even Though We Left)
episodes.description: We unpack the parts of Catholicism we still love and live by: the dignity of every person, preferential option for the poor, workers’ rights, solidarity, and care for creation. We get honest about where politics eclipsed the Gospel, why those same values led us out, and how community, ritual, silence, and values-based living still shape our daily lives—queer-affirming, neighbor-minded, and deeply human. 00:00 Small Group: Rose and Thorn 02:02 Positive Influences from Catholic Upbringing 04:12 The Value of Human Dignity 07:02 Reflections on Relationships and Complementarity 11:01 Building Community and Self-Sacrifice 13:07 Catholic Social Teaching: Core Values 19:04 Solidarity and Care for God's Creation 25:12 Community, Rituals, and Traditions 27:39 Navigating Spirituality Beyond Catholicism 36:37 The Importance of Silence and No Phone Time 43:24 Values-Based Living and Personal Growth

episodes.title: 60. Why are Catholic Billionaires Funding a Political "Mission Field" in DC?
episodes.description: Franciscan University has launched a $10 million “Homeland Mission” in Washington DC — partnering with groups like the Heritage Foundation and the Museum of the Bible. In this episode, Evelyn and Veronica unpack how the project connects to a broader movement of Christian nationalism, the donors behind it, and what it signals about the growing Catholic presence in U.S. politics. From prayer breakfasts to policy influence, this conversation explores faith, money, and power in America’s capital. 00:00 Small Group: Rose and Thorn 03:22 Franciscan University's Homeland Mission Details 07:36 Donor Contributions and Impact 10:21 Event Highlights and Alumni Involvement 14:14 Philanthropy and Broader Contributions 17:28 Residential Facilities for Students in DC 19:57 Project 2025 and Trump's Influence 21:15 Catholicism and Conservative Politics 25:41 Immigration and Long-term Political Strategies 30:36 Concerns About Right-Wing Catholic Politics

episodes.title: 59. State of the Union According to LifeTeen
episodes.description: Join us as we unpack Life Teen’s State of Catholic Youth in America (2024) — breaking down “the five cries of youth,” the XLT/adoration model, summer camps, Steubenville ties, and the report’s framing of anxiety, gender dysphoria, politics, and phones. This episode is for devout parents, deconstructors, and anyone curious about how Catholic youth culture really works. Read along with us as we discuss LifeTeen's "2024 Report on The State of Catholic Youth in America." Support us on Patreon!

episodes.title: 58. Chiles Chit Chat
episodes.description:
Veronica walks us through Chiles v. Salazar—the Supreme Court challenge to Colorado’s conversion-therapy ban. We unpack what the law actually prohibits (licensed claims to change orientation or gender identity), what it explicitly allows (client-led support and identity exploration), why “professional conduct” is regulate-able, and how amicus briefs—from Catholic orgs to ex-Exodus leaders — frame the stakes for LGBTQ+ youth, families, and faith communities.

episodes.description: What do we mean when we talk about culty/fundie/high-control Catholicism? Join us as we break down the BITE model of authoritarian control & the mind games that can make certain Catholic communities more than a little bit culty

episodes.title: 43. We're Both Dating Women Now (ft. Garrett Pryor)
episodes.description: A gay ex-Catholic and an ex-gay Christian walk into a bar... Join me as I chat with Garrett about faith, queerness, and all the messy stuff in between. We dive into our complicated feelings about the church, how psychology and spirituality mix, why talking about queerness and mental health is so hard, and maintaining mutual respect across deeply different beliefs

episodes.title: 42. Charlotte's Story: From Poster Child to Prisoner of the Pro-Life Movement
episodes.description: Charlotte was once the pro-life movement's poster child-- a young survivor of sexual assault who wanted to carry her baby to term. As a child, her story was exploited by the movement to further the push for extreme anti-abortion policy. As she grew and evolved, her opinions on policy became more complex, and eventually led her to quietly step back from the movement. When she found herself considering abortion as an adult, former friends from the movement filed a fraudulent affidavit in an attempt to prevent her from attending her appointment. Charlotte's story is one I wish she didn't have to tell, but a deeply important one nonetheless. She speaks to the exploitation of minors and vulnerable communities within the pro-life movement, and the extreme lengths they will go to if you attempt to leave. Charlotte's Instagram Charlotte's Substack

episodes.title: 32. When the Trans Woman Becomes a Dominican (ft. Nicole)
episodes.description: Join Veronica for a conversation with Nicole, a trans woman in the process of joining the Third Order Dominicans. You can find Nicole @transfiguredcatholic on YouTube and Instagram. Subscribe to our Patreon and give us a follow @leavelaughlovepod on Instagram and TikTok to stay up to date! Show Notes Dignitas Infinita , the declaration on human dignity by the Dicastery for the Doctrine of the Faith. What Vatican II ALMOST Taught About Sex Changes , Catholic Answers, November 17, 2021. Nicole references a draft of a document that didn’t make the final cut of promulgated documents from the Second Vatican Council. I can’t find a ton about it online, but you can check out Fr. Hugh Barbour, O. Praem., talking about it for 37 minutes on Catholic Answers (or read the transcript like I did). Coccinelle was an iconic French celebrity actress who underwent sex reassignment surgery in 1958, widely believed to be the first celebrity to do so. Coccinelle went on to marry a cis man in the Catholic Church, a fact which Nicole thinks sparked the discussions surrounding sex reassignment at Vatican II (see above). I’m obsessed with her. Click here for a bio of Coccinelle . In 1997, Cardinal Raymond Burke approved the founding of the Francsican Servants of Jesus by trans woman Julie Green in La Crosse, Wisconsin. This is so shocking today because of Cardinal Burke’s current and outspoken anti-LGBT views . In 1975, one couple sought an annulment that rocked the Church and suggests that the Church’s positions on how to determine sex and gender are not so black and white as the conservatives want us to believe. Read about it here: High Court’s 1975 Decision Points to Alternative Vatican Path on Gender Identity Issues , New Ways Ministry, June 17, 2019. Some Gender-Affirming Care May Be Permitted, Says Vatican Cardinal , New Ways Ministry, March 14, 2025. This article references new comments from Cardinal Victor Manuel Fernández regarding the permissibility of sex reassignment surgeries. Cardinal Fernández is the prefect of the Dicastery for the Doctrine of the Faith and originally penned Dignitas Infinita. Read the unexpected and fascinating story of St. Marina the Monk here (yes this links to Wikipedia, but trust me, this narrative is way more readable than other sources ). Read along with the Office of Readings for the feast of Sts. Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen here . Here’s just a snippet: “In this way we began to feel affection for each other. When, in the course of time, we acknowledged our friendship and recognized that our ambition was a life of true wisdom, we became everything to each other: we shared the same lodging, the same table, the same desires, the same goal. Our love for each other grew daily warmer and deeper.”

episodes.title: 26. Making Stories Heard (ft. Jenn Morson)
episodes.description: Jenn shares her story of how she found herself covering abuse cases in the Catholic Church as a journalist. You can find Jenn’s Substack, Believer, here . Check out our new Patreon for exclusive content as we build our community! Show Notes and Links Facebook group mentioned: You're probably from the Franciscan University of Steubenville if Alumnae question Franciscan University of Steubenville's commitment to Title IX , National Catholic Reporter, April 16, 2018. “When Annie confided in friend what had happened, the friend went to Fr. David Morrier, then-coordinator of Household Life and campus ministry. ‘Father Morrier encouraged me to seek therapy, which I did. He did not encourage me to go to the police or file any kind of report.’ Instead, Annie says, ‘He told me my behavior was compromising and encouraged me to go to confession.’ Then Morrier, without her permission, confronted the assailant. Annie said that Morrier not only violated her confidence but also put her in jeopardy. As a result, Annie's case was never reported to any authority, and her alleged rapist faced no consequences.” The Soros-Funded Attacks on Orthodox Catholic Universities , Crisis Magazine, April 27, 2018: After the National Catholic Reporter published the above article, Crisis Magazine responded with this hit piece on the “coordinated attack” on conservative Catholic colleges supposedly funded by "billionaire philanthropist" George Soros. Plaque's removal from Franciscan University exposes abuse by former chaplain , National Catholic Reporter, October 31, 2018: Undeterred, Jenn continued to share the stories of women who reached out to her. New residence director rejoices in campus’ Christ-centered focus , The Troubadour, November 12, 2018: Veronica encountered some of the drama surrounding the Title IX scandals in her own journalism for the student newspaper. A staff member that she interviewed that fall asked to state on record, “‘... my boss, Catherine Heck, is absolutely amazing. Sometimes I think Catherine is on campus working more with students than I am, and I live here!’” Jenn's first post on Twitter with the Dropbox link to documentation on the Fr. David Morrier case , October 28, 2022. Direct Dropbox link here ! Another Twitter post from October 28, 2022. New allegations charge Franciscan University abuse cover up , The Pillar, October 28, 2022: The Pillar also picked up the story about David Morrier. Centralized Location for Documentation of Father David Morrier , Jenn’s Substack, June 22, 2023. Maryland Same-Sex Civil Marriage Referendum, Question 6 (2012) , Ballotpedia. Jenn shares how she voted yes on Prop 6 to legalize same-sex marriage in Maryland prior to Obergefell v. Hodges. Allegations Against Father Gregory Plow, TOR, currently assigned to Franciscan University of Steubenville , Jenn’s Substack, June 26, 2023. A Response to Fr. David Pivonka's Alumni Email , Jenn’s Substack, June 28, 2023: Fr. Dave sent out an email to staff, current students, and alumni regarding Jenn’s article. Jenn includes the text of the original email as well as her response here. Fr. Dave’s comments: “These allegations did not involve sexual misconduct or criminal conduct… When the allegations were raised in 2012, Franciscan University investigated the matter in accordance with the policies at that time and reported it immediately to the Diocese of Steubenville. The University's investigation concluded that University policy was not violated, nor did a sexual assault or criminal conduct occur.” Others Share Their Allegations Against Father Gregory Plow, TOR , Jenn’s Substack, June 30, 2023. My Experience With Father Gregory Plow, TOR , Jenn’s Substack, August 28, 2023.

episodes.title: 25. Breaking up with Jesus (ft. Ben)
episodes.description: Join Veronica and guest star Ben as they talk about “all things church and gay,” as she so eloquently puts it at the start of the episode. Thank you so much for supporting our podcast! New episodes are released (almost) every Sunday. Make sure to give us a follow @leavelaughlovepod on Instagram & TikTok and leave a review wherever you find our podcast. Check out our new Patreon !! I am working on reposting all of our episodes on Patreon with fuller show notes (sneak peek below!), which will be available to all patrons whether paid or free. Show Notes Watch the first project Ben and Veronica did together on Intrinsically Ordered, Gay Ex Trad’s alt podcast account: Responding to Trent Horn's '7 Questions Liberals Can't Answer' - Non-Catholic Answers Ep 1 God is… Main Campus 2, June 2014: “The Atheist” video by Sean Forrest . Start at 5:25 for the skit video, and stick around for his proof of God’s existence through the design of a Rolex watch! (Veronica really thought he ate with this.) CBS News: “ Vice President JD Vance blasts U.S. Catholic bishops condemning ICE entering churches and schools ” CMSWR mentioned!! Theology of the Body for Teens: Middle School Edition . Veronica can’t believe that her and Ben both used this curriculum in seventh grade. (Not an affiliate link, but can you imagine if it was lol) Glory dust is often associated with Bethel Church, where “glory clouds” of gold dust are routinely seen in the air above the congregants during worship, but sometimes also appears on the hands of the devout during charismatic prayer across Christian denominations. “ Concerning the Criteria for the Discernment of Vocations with regard to Persons with Homosexual Tendencies in view of their Admission to the Seminary and to Holy Orders ,” promulgated by the Congregation for Catholic Education branch of the Vatican on November 4, 2005. Here’s the quote mentioned by Ben: “Such persons, in fact, find themselves in a situation that gravely hinders them from relating correctly to men and women. One must in no way overlook the negative consequences that can derive from the ordination of persons with deep-seated homosexual tendencies (2.5).” I don’t know what they’re tripping on, because I think Ben and I relate to one another just fine… “ Doubt is not the same as unbelief ” by Shelby Abbot Intrinsically Ordered’s recent podcast episode on the Vatican’s documents regarding the admittance of men experiencing same-sex attraction to the seminary: Can Gay Men Become Catholic Priests? Gay Ex-Catholics Explain Recent Italian Bishops' Document The Beauty and Graces of a Josephite Marriage Franciscan University’s Compendium on Human Sexuality : The two “practical application” sections significantly longer than the others are “sexual identity” and “same-sex attraction” (transgender and gay identities, respectively). The relevant quote from page 10 on coming out with prudence: “A person will likely sometimes have reason to let others know that he or she has this inclination, for example, as part of the formation of chaste and wholesome friendships in which people help one another in their common pursuit of virtue and holiness (e.g., a Courage group, a small group of friends, or as part of Franciscan University’s Integratis ministry) (cf. CCC 2359). Still, one ought not act as though this inclination were good or even neutral, and prudence should be used in decisions about letting others know about one’s same-sex attractions or desires.” "Journeying With Friends Who Have LGBT+ Experiences" - Manny Gonzalez at Franciscan University
